{{Day}}

==Events==
* [[475]] &ndash; [[Romulus Augustulus]] is proclaimed [[Western Roman Emperor]].
* [[683]] &ndash; During the [[Siege of Mecca (683)|Siege of Mecca]], the [[Kaaba]] catches fire and is burned down.
*[[1517]] &ndash; [[Protestant Reformation]]: [[Martin Luther]] posts his [[95 theses]] on the door of the Castle Church in [[Wittenberg]].
*[[1587]] &ndash; [[Leiden University Library]] opens its doors after its founding in [[1575]].
*[[1822]] &ndash; [[Emperor]] [[Agustín de Iturbide]] attempts to dissolve the Congress of the [[First Mexican Empire|Mexican Empire]].
*[[1861]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: Citing failing health, [[United States|Union]] General [[Winfield Scott]] resigns as Commander of the [[United States Army]].
*[[1863]] &ndash; The [[Maori Wars]] resume as [[British Empire|British]] forces in [[New Zealand]] led by General [[Duncan Cameron (general)|Duncan Cameron]] begin their [[Invasion of the Waikato]].
*[[1864]] &ndash; [[Nevada]] is admitted as the 36th [[U.S. state]].
*[[1876]] &ndash; A monster [[cyclone]] ravages [[India]], resulting in over 200,000 deaths.
*[[1913]] &ndash; Dedication of the [[Lincoln Highway]], the first automobile highway across [[United States]].
*  1913   &ndash; The [[Indianapolis Street Car Strike of 1913|Indianapolis Street Car Strike and subsequent riot]] begins.
*[[1917]] &ndash; [[World War I]]: [[Battle of Beersheba (1917)|Battle of Beersheba]] &ndash; the "last successful cavalry charge in history".
*[[1918]] &ndash; World War I: Dissolution of the [[Austria-Hungary|Austro-Hungarian Empire]].
*[[1922]] &ndash; [[Benito Mussolini]] is made [[Prime Minister of Italy]]
*[[1923]] &ndash; The first of 160 consecutive days of 100º [[Fahrenheit]] at [[Marble Bar]], [[Australia]].
*[[1924]] &ndash; [[World Savings Day]] is announced in [[Milan]], [[Kingdom of Italy|Italy]] by the Members of the Association at the 1st International [[Savings Bank]] Congress (World Society of Savings Banks).
*[[1926]] &ndash; Magician [[Harry Houdini]] dies of [[gangrene]] and [[peritonitis]] that develops after his [[vermiform appendix|appendix]] ruptures.
*[[1938]] &ndash; [[Great Depression]]: In an effort to restore investor confidence, the [[New York Stock Exchange]] unveils a fifteen-point program aimed to upgrade protection for the investing public.
*[[1940]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: The [[Battle of Britain]] ends &ndash; the [[United Kingdom]] prevents a possible [[Nazi Germany|German]] invasion.
*[[1941]] &ndash; After 14 years of work, [[Mount Rushmore]] is completed.
*  1941   &ndash; World War II: The destroyer {{USS|Reuben James|DD-245|6}} is torpedoed by a [[Nazi Germany|German]] [[U-boat]] near [[Iceland]], killing more than 100 [[United States Navy|U.S. Navy]] sailors. It is the first U.S. Navy vessel sunk by enemy action in WWII.
*[[1943]] &ndash; World War II: An [[F4U Corsair]] accomplishes the first successful [[radar]]-guided interception by a [[United States Navy|USN]] or [[United States Marine Corps|USMC]] aircraft.
*[[1944]] &ndash; [[Erich Göstl]], a member of the [[Waffen-SS]], is awarded the [[Knight's Cross of the Iron Cross]], to recognise extreme battlefield bravery, after losing his face and eyes during the [[Operation Overlord|Battle of Normandy]].
*[[1956]] &ndash; [[Suez Crisis]]: The [[United Kingdom]] and [[France]] begin bombing [[Republic of Egypt (1953–58)|Egypt]] to force the reopening of the [[Suez Canal]].
*[[1961]] &ndash; In the [[Soviet Union]], [[Joseph Stalin]]'s body is removed from [[Lenin's Mausoleum|Vladimir Lenin's Tomb]].
*[[1963]] &ndash; An explosion at the Indiana State Fair Coliseum (now [[Fairgrounds Coliseum|Pepsi Coliseum]]) in Indianapolis kills 74 people and injures another 400 during an ice skating show.  A faulty propane tank connection in a concession stand is blamed.
*[[1968]] &ndash; [[Vietnam War]] [[October surprise]]: Citing progress with the [[Paris]] peace talks, US President [[Lyndon B. Johnson]] announces to the nation that he has ordered a complete cessation of "all air, naval, and artillery bombardment of [[North Vietnam]]" effective [[November 1]].
*[[1973]] &ndash; [[1973 Mountjoy Prison helicopter escape|Mountjoy Prison helicopter escape]]. Three [[Provisional Irish Republican Army]] members escape from [[Mountjoy Prison]], [[Dublin]], [[Republic of Ireland]] aboard a hijacked helicopter that lands in the exercise yard.
*[[1984]] &ndash; [[India]]n Prime Minister [[Indira Gandhi]] is [[assassination of Indira Gandhi|assassinated]] by two Sikh security guards. [[1984 anti-Sikh riots|Riots break out]] in [[New Delhi]] and other cities and nearly 10,000 Sikhs are killed.
*[[1998]] &ndash; [[Iraq disarmament crisis]] begins: [[Iraq]] announces it would no longer cooperate with [[United Nations]] weapons inspectors.
*[[1999]] &ndash; [[Yachtsman]] [[Jesse Martin]] returns to [[Melbourne]] after 11 months of [[circumnavigation|circumnavigating]] the world, solo, non-stop and unassisted.
*  1999   &ndash; [[EgyptAir Flight 990]] crashes into the Atlantic Ocean killing all 217 people on board.
*[[2000]] &ndash; [[Soyuz TM-31]] launches, carrying the first resident crew to the [[International Space Station]]. The ISS has been crewed continuously since then.
*[[2002]] &ndash; A federal grand jury in [[Houston, Texas]] indicts former [[Enron]] chief financial officer [[Andrew Fastow]] on 78 counts of [[wire fraud]], [[money laundering]], [[Conspiracy (crime)|conspiracy]] and [[obstruction of justice]] related to the collapse of his ex-employer.
*[[2003]] &ndash; [[Mahathir bin Mohamad]] resigns as [[Prime Minister of Malaysia|Prime Minister]] of [[Malaysia]] and is replaced by [[Deputy Prime Minister of Malaysia|Deputy Prime Minister]] [[Abdullah Ahmad Badawi]], marking an end to Mahathir's 22 years in power.
*[[2011]] &ndash; The [[global population]] of humans reaches seven billion. This day is now recognized by the [[United Nations]] as [[Day of Seven Billion|Seven Billion Day]].

*Christian [[Feast Day]]:
**[[Abaidas]] ([[Coptic Orthodox Church of Alexandria|Coptic Church]])
**[[St. Quentin|Quentin]]
**[[Martin Luther]] ([[Anglican Communion]])
**[[Paul Shinji Sasaki]] and [[Philip Lindel Tsen]] ([[Episcopal Church (USA)]])
**[[October 31 (Eastern Orthodox liturgics)]]
*Earliest day on which [[Public holidays in Finland|All Saints Day]] can fall, while November 6 is the latest; celebrated on Saturday between October 31 and November 6 ([[Finland]], [[Sweden]])
*Eve of Winter, the eve of the first day of winter in the Northern hemisphere (see November 1):
**[[Allantide]] ([[Cornwall]])
**[[Halloween]] ([[Republic of Ireland|Ireland]], [[Canada]], [[United Kingdom]], [[United States]] and [[Halloween around the world|other places]])
**[[Samhain]] in the [[Northern Hemisphere]], [[Beltane]] in the [[Southern Hemisphere]]; begins on sunset of October 31 ([[Gaelic calendar|Gaels]], [[Welsh people]] and [[Neopagan]] [[Wheel of the Year]])
*[[Public holidays in Cambodia|King Father's Birthday]] ([[Cambodia]])
*[[Reformation Day]] ([[Slovenia]], [[Germany]] and [[Lutheran Church]])
